Due to Homeland Security measures, foreign travel into the US is down 30%. Those were new dollars formerly pumped into our economy, not the same old recycled consumer and government debt dollars. According to those in the travel industry, many foreign travelers are saying our airport and visa hassles just aren't worth it. And that report doesn't include the new request of photos and fingerprints upon entry.
 
 Does anyone actually believe our vastly expensive fumbling federal airport doorshaker type security efforts (my shoes, please), foreign entry inconvenience and cute rainbow alert system would stop a dedicated terrorist with two oceans, two huge land borders and virtually unlimited private boat and aircraft entry readily available? What terrorist would be stupid enough to use those well-publicized bottlenecks? To me, it sounds like more 'your government is taking care of you' spin. Your papers pleeze.

We have some real consistency issues here. If you arrive to the United States in an airplane, we want to fingerprint you, scan you, X-ray your luggage, and possibly question you. If you are one of the nameless, faceless, illegals that sneak over the border in the dark of night, this administration wants to grant you citizenship and collect taxes from you. Forget the fact that we know nothing about your background or why you really want to be here. Personally, I think we could have solved a large part of our airline security issues simply by locking the cockpit doors. If the would be terrorists can't get control of the aircraft and use the plane as a weapon, it greatly deminishes the magnitude of their attack.
